I am currently taking your Pluralsight course AngularJS Patterns: Clean Code. I followed your instructions leading up to the lesson “Running the Code With WebStorm,” but I can’t get the cc-bmean app to run when I enter http://localhost:3001 in the browser. I get the errors below after starting MongoDB and starting the cc-bmean server configuration:

“C:\Program Files (x86)\JetBrains\WebStorm 8.0.5\bin\runnerw.exe” “C:\Program Files\nodejs\node.exe” src\server\app.js About to crank up node PORT=3001 NODE_ENV=undefined (hardcoding ‘devel’ in app.js removes error here, but same result below) ** DEV ** ******** Code Camper MEAN Server Listening on port 3001

Remember to first start MongoDb server ********

env = development port = 3001 __dirname = c:\code\git\ng-demos\cc-bmean\src\server process.cwd() = c:\code\git\ng-demos\cc-bmean Retrieved collection handles: Persons, Rooms, Sessions, TimeSlots, Tracks GET /bower_components/bootstrap/dist/css/bootstrap.min.css 404 6.831 ms - 66 etc. Oddly enough, if I change the configuration’s current directory from C:\code\git\ng-demos\cc-bmean to C:\code\git\ng-demos\modular and enter http://localhost:2700, the local Avengers web page is displayed. How do I get the configuration to find the files under ng-demos/modular/bower_components when the current directory is set to ng-demos/cc-bmean ? Thank you… AUTHOR: J.
